Chemical Society 2025 The Authors https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/ This article is licensed under CC-BY-NC-ND 4.0 Phase separation is closely related to the transcription, processing,
translation, and metabolism of RNA, and regulating RNA phase separation
may serve as an effective antitumor strategy. However, small molecule-based
RNA phase separation inducers have not yet been reported. Herein,
based on our previous work, we designed a Ru­(II) complex ( Ru1 Ru1 Ru1 phase separation ruthenium complex antitumor photodynamic therapy tumor immune microenvironments National Natural Science Foundation of China 10.13039/501100001809 22177142 Basic and Applied Basic Research Foundation of Guangdong Province 10.13039/501100021171 2022A1515111089 Basic and Applied Basic Research Foundation of Guangdong Province 10.13039/501100021171 2023A1515010625 Basic and Applied Basic Research Foundation of Guangdong Province 10.13039/501100021171 2024B1515040028 pmc-status-qastatus 0 pmc-status-live yes pmc-status-embargo no pmc-status-released yes pmc-prop-open-access yes pmc-prop-olf no pmc-prop-manuscript no pmc-prop-legally-suppressed no pmc-prop-has-pdf yes pmc-prop-has-supplement yes pmc-prop-pdf-only no pmc-prop-suppress-copyright no pmc-prop-is-real-version no pmc-prop-is-scanned-article no pmc-prop-preprint no pmc-prop-in-epmc yes document-id-old-9 au5c00867 document-id-new-14 au5c00867 production-flag-MathML-config-version 3 production-flag-journal-citation-display-style acs-titles production-flag-journal-date-display-style dates-used-rcd-rvd-acc production-flag-si-avail yes document-id-alt-64 761e8230c1b8846512f4f431f98d3019b3bed473fc49fdbf879a16bc4d6874d9 1 Introduction The formation of biomolecular condensates via phase separation
has recently emerged as a widespread mechanism underlying the spatiotemporal
coordination of biological activities in cells.       RNA plays important regulatory roles in many physiological processes
including cell proliferation, embryonic development, metabolism, and
inflammatory responses.      In addition to platinum-based anticancer drugs that have achieved
great success in the clinic, nonplatinum anticancer complexes have
also made great progress recently.   By structural modifications on ligands, Ru­(II) polypyridyl complexes
can target different nucleic acid structures, including double-stranded
DNA (dsDNA), G-quadruplex DNA, and RNA.
